channel.title: Help with Compiling and Running?
channel.description:
Ok so I have just started to make a server and I am using the Battlescape source and I have set my environment variables and I have portforwarded and when I click on the server folder there is 2 things. First one is Compile and second one is Run. When i click
Compile this is what i get:
[IMG]http://i628.photobucket.com/albums/uu3/Dzhambik6/privateserverhelp1.jpg[/img]
When i click "RUN" this is what i get:
[IMG]http://i628.photobucket.com/albums/uu3/Dzhambik6/privateserverhelp2-1.jpg[/img]
Does anybody know how to fix this? Thanks.

item.title: Help with Compiling and Running?
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“Ms. Kay, post:6, topic:323865”]This error occurs because your system cannot find the path specified.[/quote]NO SHIT.

For the compiler, try find a JDK folder in C:\Program Files\Java
Right click your compiler click edit and change the line that says something like “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe” to your Java version, the jdk1.6.0_16 part. Just right click on your JDK folder click rename and copy and paste the Java version over your current one. Try that, if not set your Environmental Variables.

For the run, you might need to do the same thing. I’m not sure. Just with JRE not JDK. (JDK comes with JRE so you can use “C:\Program Files\Java[b]YOURJDKVERSIONHERE[/b]\bin\java.exe”

It might not work but try it, I always have to do that when I get a new computer or download a new server

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Compiling and Running?
item.dc:creator: @Ms_Kay Ms. Kay
item.description:
@Ms_Kay wrote:

This error occurs because your system cannot find the path specified.
Also, you do not have your Environmental Variables set.

Read full topic

For the compiler, it means you havent set the enviornment variables correct, you have to re-do it. As for the “run” not sure whats wrong, looking into it.
